example_map module¶

example_map.alan_speak_callback(person, player)¶

“Speak” callback for a helpful game character who explains game rules & commands

To attach to a Person object, pass this callback to the text_game_maker.Person constructor when creating a Person instance

Parameters:
  • person (text_game_maker.Person) – the Person that this callback is attached to
  • player (text_game_maker.Player) – Player instance
example_map.enter_window_callback(player, src, dest)¶

Enter callback for a tile that kills the player as soon as they enter. Called when player attempts to enter whichever room this callback is attached to.

Attach to current room with text_game_maker.set_on_enter()

Parameters:
  • player (text_game_maker.Player) – text_game_maker.Player object
  • src (text_game_maker.Tile) – source tile (the tile that player is trying to exit)
  • dest (text_game_maker.Tile) – destination tile (the tile that player is trying to enter)
example_map.locked_room_enter_callback(player, src, dest)¶

Enter callback for a room with a locked door that can only be unlocked by an item named ‘metal key’. Called when player attempts to enter whichever tile this callback is attached to.

Attach to current room with text_game_maker.set_on_enter()

Parameters:
  • player (text_game_maker.Player) – Player instance
  • src (text_game_maker.Tile) – source tile (the tile that player is trying to exit)
  • dest (text_game_maker.Tile) – destination tile (the tile that player is trying to enter)
example_map.main()¶
